intro: Cephaelis prunifolia, commonly known as the rose of Jericho, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a unique ability to survive drought conditions by curling its leaves and flowers into a tight ball. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners and collectors.
